protocols

    Dark Mode

This library provides concepts and implementations for highly composeable network/data protocols.

For instance, you can build a message-oriented protocol then connect that protocol over a TCP socket, or an HTTP client, or Websockets, or a Unix domain socket. You can chain protocols together (to add encryption, for instance).

Concepts

There protocols that consume particular types of data and those that provide that type of data. To that end, the different categories of consumers/providers are defined in protocols/base. In summary:

  • SocketProvider
  • SocketConsumer
  • StreamProvider
  • StreamConsumer
  • MessageProvider
  • MessageConsumer
  • GenericProvider[T]
  • GenericConsumer[T]

Some protocols are just Consumers. Some are just Providers. And some are both. Protocols adhering to these concepts can easily be hooked together.

For instance, the included util/TestSocket is a SocketProvider that acts like a socket, but reads/writes from memory for use in testing. Anything SocketConsumer can use a SocketProvider.

The netstring/NetstringTransport is both a StreamConsumer and a MessageProvider. Attach it to any StreamProvider and attach any MessageConsumer to it.

Lifecycle

Protocols have a common lifecycle as defined by base.Connectable. In summary, the lifecycle is:

  1. Created
  2. Open and ready to send/receive data
  3. Closed

Utility implementations

protocols/base
